name: Hsh
tagline: Home Smart Home: The Internet of Things to make home a smart place.
body:
# Project goals

* Follow-up the power consumption, the temperature, and other key parameters of my house.

* Control some appliances in order to improve the energy efficiency, and maybe make life easier.

 

# Architecture

A set of remote sensors and actuators is connected to a central server using a wireless network.

[https://raw.githubusercontent.com/nbremond77/hsh/master/Documentation/Architecture%20-%20rev%201.png](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/nbremond77/hsh/master/Documentation/Architecture%20-%20rev%201.png)

The central server monitors energy, temperature, etc... parameters.

The remote sensors can determine:

The local temperature, relative humidity, pressure...
The power consumption of the appliance, or of a part of my electrical grid
Some remote actuators can be used to control appliances:

Air conditioning
Water pump
etc...
# Hardware

## Remote sensors

### Remote sensors  - Nucleo STM32F411RE or STM32L152RE based - called "Multisensor board":
* Radio interface IEEE802.15.4, supporting 6LowPan, for the wireless network
* 1 x AC Current and Voltage ADC inputs used to calculate AC power
* 1-Wire interface for DS18B20 temperature sensor or
* Interface for the DHT22 humidity and temperature sensor
* BMP180 pressure sensor interface
* IR receive interface
* IR transmit interface
* RS485/DMX interface
* 2 x digital outputs
* battery powered with step-up power supply

### Remote sensors - Arduino due based - called "Energy monitor board":
* Radio interface IEEE802.15.4, supporting 6LowPan, for the wireless network
* 11 x AC Current and Voltage ADC inputs used to calculate AC power
* 1-Wire interface for DS18B20 temperature sensor or
* Interface for the DHT22 humidity and temperature sensor
* BMP180 pressure sensor interface
* IR receive interface
* IR transmit interface
* 2 x RS485/DMX interfaces
* 8 x digital outputs
* DC powered

## Main server

Raspberry Pi with:
* Radio interface IEEE802.15.4, supporting 6LowPan, for the wireless network
* Ethernet connection to the home ethernet network

# Software

## Remote sensors

Based on a real time operating system supporting IPv6 and 6LowPan wireless network.

## Main server

Based on Linux, supporting Ethernet (IPv4 or IPv6) and IPv6 6LowPan network interfaces.
Using EmonCMS monitoring server.

## What has been done yet ?

Electronic Schematic of Remote sensors shields: Done

PCB of Remote sensors shields: Done
* 1st prototype received...
* Some mistakes need corrections

Remote sensor software: In progress
* Looking for a real time operating system with 6LowPan and IPv6 stack
* Currently looking at RIOT, Contiki, and mBed

Server: To be done.
